common_issues.title: LTM and Workstream Issues on macOS
common_issues.description: Users on macOS are experiencing issues with LTM and Workstream functionality, including queries not returning results, slow performance, and failure to record new activities.  Some users report that clearing LTM data temporarily resolves the issue.  Additionally, Pro users are encountering errors suggesting they need to upgrade despite having a Pro subscription.

related_issues.title: Bug: Subscription is not showing up within the Application(cancelation + resubscription w/ a new plan)
related_issues.text:
Bug: Subscription is not showing up within the Application(cancelation + resubscription w/ a new plan)
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

So when I freshly install Pieces, the LTM works fine.

When I've had it running for a few weeks, and I want to query the LTM, the query takes forever, and returns nothing.

The same happens via the MCP.

I use my machine all day, so there's a lot of context going into the LTM. The only explanation I can come up with is that it's just getting too big. The Workstream is, however, updating fine.

Removing all my Pieces data gets the LTM working again, but then I end up with this situation later. This is the third time I've been through this loop. It's really frustrating, because when I actually need the LTM, it fails.

The Clear LTM Data button doesn't work, just returning to Try again, from All Data to even for just clearing an hour of data.

I haven't cleared the LTM (well, I've tried, but the Clear LTM Data button doesn't work) so we have a live broken environment to debug with. I'm more than happy to assist with debugging this - let me know what you need!

related_issues.title: I'm sorry. This feature requires Pieces Pro. Please upgrade your plan or change your LLM to continue.
related_issues.text:
I'm sorry. This feature requires Pieces Pro. Please upgrade your plan or change your LLM to continue.
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When using Pieces I asked, "what did I work today?" and I received an error that says `I'm sorry. This feature requires Pieces Pro. Please upgrade your plan or change your LLM to continue.`  When I have paid for pro and am signed in. What I expect is that I can use my paid pro membership to run query and not receive an error.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS services failing to open on MacOS
common_issues.description: Multiple users reported Pieces Settings and Core Services failing to open on MacOS.  Errors include "Type ZJb already registered" and websocket connection failures with 404 status code. Issues observed across different MacOS versions (15.5, 15.7) and PiecesOS versions (12.1.1, Unknown). Potential solutions include reinstalling PiecesOS, checking firewall settings, and ensuring correct port configuration.

common_issues.title: Auto-Generated Context Resets to Medium, Settings Service Issues
common_issues.description: Users report the Auto-Generated Context in the Pieces desktop app (macOS) reverting to "Medium" despite selecting "High".  Additionally, errors like "Invalid argument(s): Type ZJb is already registered inside GetIt" occur when opening the Pieces Settings Service.  Further investigation is needed to determine the relationship between these issues and potential solutions.

related_issues.title: Auto Generated Context Always returns to Medium
related_issues.text:
Auto Generated Context Always returns to Medium
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

Platform MacOS Version 15.5 (Build 24F74)

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hello!

This is an issue that I've seen happen in all of the builds since I've started using pieces. When changing the Auto-Generated Context (Saved Material Enrichment) option in Machine Learning from the menu, in my case I want it to be "High", but every time I change it, when I check the next day or any time later, or every time the app or os updates, the option selected goes back to "Medium". So I don't actually even know if it ever used "High", because it always returns the option to "Medium".

common_issues.title: Pieces Copilot Service fails to open on MacOS
common_issues.description: Users are unable to open the Pieces Copilot Service on MacOS.  Two distinct errors are observed: 'Instance of 'fp'' and 'HttpException: Connection reset by peer'. Affected users are running MacOS versions 15.5 and 15.6 with Pieces OS versions 11.0.4 and 12.1.1. The issue might be related to Pieces OS version compatibility or network connectivity problems. Check for Pieces OS updates or firewall issues.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS 12.1.1 Bugs and Feature Requests
common_issues.description: Users report issues with copying code blocks, dragging files into conversation context, and upgrading to the latest LLM version (Sonnet 4). Copying inline code blocks behaves unexpectedly, and dragging files into the conversation context is not functioning.  Additionally, despite upgrading to Pieces Pro and selecting Sonnet 4, the LLM remains on Sonnet 3.5 in Pieces for Developers and VS Code plugin. A feature request has been made to allow partial copying of inline code blocks.

related_issues.title: Copy python code block = copy message ? what a big mistake !!
related_issues.text: Copy python code block = copy message ? what a big mistake !! ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Desktop Application ### Operating System / Platform Windows ### Your Pieces OS Version 12.1.1 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. 1. The 2nd pic below do not function properly: The description of this problem only requires one line equation, and inequality of graphics: - it should be: Copy copilot message ≠ Copy `inter-line code block` (floating) = Copy `inter-line code block` (fixed) - however: = ≠ - how could Copy `inter-line code block` (floating)= Copy `inter-line code block` (floating) ? absolute wrong. - it should be like: Copy `inter-line code block` (floating)= Copy `inter-line code block` (fixed) by design. 2. Copy improperly: if one copies `in-line code block` through ctrl+c (rather than the "copy button" provided alongside), it is very likely (coupled with double click) to paste it into " ￼ ". 3. Feature: Hopefully, the `in-line code block` can be partially copied (rather than merely allowing all copies) like the inter-line code block to improve efficiency. related_issues.title: Pro user's LLM cannot be upgraded to the latest version, even if they are chosen to
related_issues.text: Pro user's LLM cannot be upgraded to the latest version, even if they are chosen to ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Desktop Application, Pieces OS, Visual Studio, Sublime Plugin, VS Code ### Operating System / Platform Windows 11 ### Your Pieces OS Version 12.1.1 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. I have a small problem now that cannot be solved through LLM: - I have inquired with LLM in **pieces for developers** and **pieces vscode plugin**, and they all said they are Sonnet 3.5. - The pieces LLM in sublime (set claude 3.7 sonnet) keeps silence about this: **Copilot**: I'm an AI assistant created by Anthropic named Claude, and my training data has a cutoff date. While I don't typically specify my exact version details, I can tell you that my knowledge cutoff is around late 2023. This means I don't have information about events, technologies, or developments that occurred after that time. However, - I just **upgraded to Pieces Pro yesterday** and have switched to Sonnet 4 (for all pieces IDE plugins and Desktop Apps, except for sublime which only support sonnet 3.7 till now). - Every test chat was opened in a new Chat after the LLM is switched( to Sonnet 4 or Gemini 2.5 Pro)... - I've checked the configuration files and they are all Sonnet 4 without any issues. - I have tried restarting my computer or logging in to my account again, but still have this bug - I have tried changing my computer and VPN node, including canceling or adding the global system proxy, but none of them worked PS: My pieces OS and pieces for developers are both installed in sequence on Microsoft Store. - They work well in other aspects. - I have been using them for about 7 days. - I am in Chinese Mainland, thus a heavy VPN user. ## Pieces for Deveopers (desktop app) ## Vscode plugin ## Sublime plugin Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

recommendations: Prioritize resolving issues related to LTM and Workstream functionality on macOS, focusing on data handling and subscription recognition.
Investigate and address the recurring problems with PiecesOS services failing to open on MacOS, specifically the "Type ZJb already registered" and websocket connection errors.
Fix the issue with Auto-Generated Context reverting to "Medium" in the Pieces desktop app on macOS.
Troubleshoot and resolve the problems preventing users from opening the Pieces Copilot Service on MacOS, addressing both the 'Instance of 'fp'' and 'Connection reset by peer' errors.
Address the bugs in Pieces OS 12.1.1 related to code block copying, file dragging into conversation context, and LLM version upgrades.
Improve communication with Pro users regarding LLM upgrades and ensure the selected LLM version is applied consistently across all platforms.
